SEARCH
Package com.cache

Class OrderCache

java.lang.Object
com.cache.AppCache<Integer,Order,Order>
com.cache.OrderCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
CacheEditer<Integer,Order>, CacheFetcher<Integer,Order,Order>
public class OrderCache extends AppCache<Integer,Order,Order>
A cache for managing Order objects, ensuring each order is uniquely identified by an order ID.
See Also:
  • AppCache

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static OrderCache getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of OrderCache.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of OrderCache.

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Integer orderID, Order order)
      Adds an order to the cache with the specified order ID. If an order with the same ID already exists, a message is printed.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The unique identifier for the order.
      order - The Order object to add to the cache.

    • removeItem

      @SafeVarargs public final void removeItem(Integer orderID, Optional<Predicate<Object>>... filters)
      Removes an order from the cache based on the specified order ID and optional filters. If the order is found and removed, a message is printed.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order to remove.
      filters - Optional filters to apply when removing the order.

    • getItem

      @SafeVarargs public final Order getItem(Integer orderID, Optional<Predicate<Object>>... filters)
      Retrieves an order from the cache based on the specified order ID and optional filters. If the order is found, it is returned; otherwise, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order to retrieve.
      filters - Optional filters to apply when retrieving the order. Not implemented.
      Returns:
      The Order object matching the criteria, or null if not found.

    • printAllItems

      public void printAllItems(Function<Order,?> function)
      Prints all orders in the cache using the specified function. Each order is processed by the provided function before printing.
      Parameters:
      function - The function to apply to each order before printing.
